frame.name: Relating_concepts
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Concept_1</fen> is related to <fen>Concept_2</fen> by some <fen>Evidence</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Evidence">The single remaining piece of evidence</fex> <t>linked</t> <fex name="Concept_1">Kirov the tailor</fex> <fex name="Concept_2">to Kirov the dissident activist</fex>.</ex>
<ex>There is <fex name="Evidence">ample data</fex> <t>relating</t> <fex name="Concept_1">earnings</fex> <fex name="Concept_2">to years of schooling.</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concept_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.
<ex>High death rates among smokers <t>connect</t> <fex name="Concept_1">cigarettes</fex> with disease.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concept_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.
<ex>Skid marks on the street <t>connects</t> my neighbor's car <fex name="Concept_2">to my broken mailbox</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Point_of_view
FE.definition:
<def-root>The point of view from which the connection exists.
<ex><fex name="Point_of_view">As far as we are concerned</fex> this evidence <t>ties</t> the secretary to the case of the missing apple fritters.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition:
<def-root>The phenomenon that points to or proves the connection between <fen>Concept_1</fen> and <fen>Concept_2</fen>. Generally expressed as an external.
<ex><fex name="Evidence">Footprints</fex> <t>connect</t> her to the crime.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the connection exists.
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">If we get the protocal right</fex> the study will <t>link</t> leprosy to too much stress-inducing homework.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Concepts
FE.definition:
<def-root>The two concepts expressed jointly.
<ex><fex name="Concept_1">Ample evidence</fex> is able to <t>connect</t> <fex name="Concepts">the two</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> of connection between the <fen>Concepts</fen>.
<ex>This <fex name="Degree">definitively</fex> <t>connects</t> our water shortage problems to the ascendance of a new governor.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Specification
FE.definition:
<def-root>A further specification on the linkage.
<ex>The evidence <fex name="Specification">causally</fex> <t>links</t> these two.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: link.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring two things together as being related

lexUnit.name: connect.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: relate one thing to another

lexUnit.name: tie.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: act as evidence for the connection between two ideas

lexUnit.name: associate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: tie two things as at least loosely related

lexUnit.name: relate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: connect two ideas as related
